data.name: 5 Seasons Bavarian Ecstasy Festbier
data.description: Kind of like our Münchner, only BIGGER! This full bodied, malty, mellow amber lager is brewed only once a year, to celebrate the Oktoberfest. Munich & Pilsen malts make this beer big and smooth, while German CaraMunich malt gives it a rich amber hue. This style is also known as Märzenbier and Weis’n Bier. Best enjoyed in a one liter Mass with three fingers of foamy head!

style.name: American-Style Amber (Low Calorie) Lager
style.description: These beers are pale golden to amber in color, light to medium-light in body, and high in carbonation. Calorie level should not exceed 125 per 12 ounce serving. Corn, rice, or other grain or sugar adjuncts may be used but all malt formulations are also made. Malt and hop flavors are mild yet evident. Hop bitterness is evident and hop aroma may be negligible to evident. Light fruity esters are acceptable. Chill haze and diacetyl should be absent.

breweries.name: 5 Seasons Brewing Company
breweries.description: 5 Seasons Brewing is passionate about serving local produce, all-natural meats, and artisanal cheeses. We believe in conserving the spirit of the farm and supporting local farmers. We are also acknowledged as the center of Atlanta’s beer culture.

data.name: 520 Copper Lager
data.description: “520” was the street address of our brewer’s grandmother’s house growing up and coincidentally years later it is the address of the brewery.  Silky smooth Germanic malts meld with a balanced combo of American and Noble hops to form an assertive, crisp finish on this copper colored Apparition.

style.name: American-Style Amber (Low Calorie) Lager

breweries.name: Lost Highway Brewing Company
breweries.description: Belgium's oldest tradition comes to Colfax!

data.name: Agate Pass Amber
data.description: Is a nice hoppy amber ale with a dark honey color. The aroma includes nuts and honey, with a pear sweetness. Then you get some toast and honey, followed by steadily increasing hop flavors.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

breweries.name: Hood Canal Brewery
breweries.description:
Hood Canal Brewery opened its doors in September 1996 in an 800 sq. Ft. pole building at the home of Don Wyatt, owner and brewer, just north of Poulsbo, Washington. Don had five years experience in home-brewing and worked at the Thomas Kemper Brewery before its closing. When Kemper's closed its doors, he decided to follow his passion and strike out on his own.
 
Distribution of Hood Canal Beers started in Kitsap County. He later expanded his sales to the Seattle area via Odom Distributing Corporation, and now he personally distributes to bars, pubs, and grocery stores in Kitsap and surrounding counties.
 
Our Tasting Room is on Bond Road between Kingston and Poulsbo. It's about the ten minute drive from the Kingston ferry terminal or from Poulsbo.

data.name: All Night Light
data.description: (Silver Medal winner L.A. Internatinal) An all malt, golden American Light Lager consisting of low hop bitterness and aroma, with a light malt body that is clean and crisp. This ultra light has great drinkability with a less filling body. However, this one contains no preservatives and provides a freshness that cannot be duplicated by a bottled beer.

breweries.name: Bull & Bones Brewhaus & Grill
breweries.description: Bull & Bones is a brewpub with both an upscale dining room and a separate sports bar with a casual dining area. Currently offering 7 craft beers brewed on site in our 10 barrel brewhaus. We have a wood-fired grill, on-site smoker, an ice rail integrated into our granite bar, 20 HDTV's, and 7 championship pool tables!

breweries.name: Big Oyster Brewery
breweries.description: Shuckin' good beer since 2015. Brewed with pride in Rehoboth Beach, Delaware

data.name: Anchor Amber Ale
data.description: Another Green Beacon favourite that lets the distinct malt profile clearly take centre stage.  Pale and Amber grists from a world famous British floor maltser, combine wonderfully to lend sublime malt character and depth to this amber ale. Copper in colour and hopped with traditional Fuggles and Goldings, Anchor is a craft delight that is good drinking all year round and a nice change up for those who prefer a malty backbone to their ales.

style.name: American-Style Amber (Low Calorie) Lager

Hop bitterness is evident and hop aroma may be negligible to evident. Light fruity esters are acceptable. Chill haze and diacetyl should be absent.

breweries.name: Green Beacon Brewing Co
breweries.description:
Green Beacon Brewing Company is Teneriffe’s first boutique craft brewery and ale works. We produce a range of local and seasonal craft beers, served alongside the best Queensland seafood.

Our beer is made on site in our brewery, which runs parallel to our bar in order to showcase the all natural and craft nature of our business. This is where all the action happens!

Come along and enjoy a craft beer or two in our rustic Teneriffe warehouse setting, watch our brewery in action, have a chat to our brewers and enjoy a plate of fresh local seafood.

style.name: American-Style Amber (Low Calorie) Lager
style.description: These beers are pale golden to amber in color, light to medium-light in body, and high in carbonation. Calorie level should not exceed 125 per 12 ounce serving. Corn, rice, or other grain or sugar adjuncts may be used but all malt formulations are also made. Malt and hop flavors are mild yet evident. Hop bitterness is evident and hop aroma may be negligible to evident. Light fruity esters are acceptable. Chill haze and diacetyl should be absent.

breweries.name: Magic Hat Brewing Company
breweries.description: The Saturnalian Saga of Magic Hat began in 1994 when our first batch of beer was brewed in a funky little space on Flynn Avenue, in Burlington, Vermont.  Dozens of beers and a brewery later, the Vermont brewery finds itself reaching more than 30 states with its unique take on classic styles.  Magic Hat continues to be a leader in craft beer and is currently the only craft brewer putting a performance in every bottle.

style.name: American-Style Amber (Low Calorie) Lager
style.description: These beers are pale golden to amber in color, light to medium-light in body, and high in carbonation. Calorie level should not exceed 125 per 12 ounce serving. Corn, rice, or other grain or sugar adjuncts may be used but all malt formulations are also made. Malt and hop flavors are mild yet evident. Hop bitterness is evident and hop aroma may be negligible to evident. Light fruity esters are acceptable. Chill haze and diacetyl should be absent.

breweries.name: Smuttynose Brewing Company
breweries.description: Smuttynose was founded in 1994 by the folks who started the Northampton and Portsmouth Breweries. We brew a wide range of beers, from our year-round beers: Finestkind IPA, Old Brown Dog, Robust Porter, Star Island Single and Shoals Pale Ale; our seasonals to The Big Beer Series & our rare Smuttlabs releases; we brew something for everyone in the 24 states where we sell beer. Smuttynose is excited to begin production in it's new state-of-the-art, energy-stingy brewery in early 2014.  Please come visit for a tour or a bite in our restaurant.

breweries.name: World Brews, Winery Exchange
breweries.description:
Winery Exchange was founded in 1999 and is headquartered in Novato, California, USA. The company maintains regional sales offices around the United States and international offices in the United Kingdom and Spain.

Winery Exchange is the only full-service, corporate brand, beverage alcohol company that sources beer, wine and spirits from the finest regions worldwide. The company was founded with the intent of blending extensive industry expertise with cutting-edge business practices. The result is a dynamic, fast-growing company poised to take advantage of new trends in the beverage alcohol industry.

data.name: Brewmaster's Select
data.description: An original premium lager skillfully crafted using our finest malt and pure yeast selected by our brewmaster.

breweries.name: Stallhagen
breweries.description:
Microbrewery Stallhagen Ab was set up in 2004 by a group of beer enthusiasts. It currently has over 1600 shareholders. The first brewery on the Åland islands was established back in the 1850's, but Stallhagen is now Åland's only brewery, with a production site at Grelsby, 18 km from Mariehamn.

The initial aim of the brewery was to produce good craft beers, mainly for the Åland market. However, with its flavorful products the company has quickly won innumerable friends outside Åland, and Stallhagen beer is now sold in both Finland and Sweden. Steadily increasing demand and investments in higher production capacity have led to a growth in sales volumes and made the Stallhagen brand well-known to beer-lovers generally, not just the growing flock of experts and connoisseurs.

style.name: American-Style Amber (Low Calorie) Lager

Hop bitterness is evident and hop aroma may be negligible to evident. Light fruity esters are acceptable. Chill haze and diacetyl should be absent.

breweries.name: August Schell Brewing Company
breweries.description: The August Schell Brewing Company is a brewing company in New Ulm, Minnesota. It was founded by German immigrants August Schell and Jacob Bernhardt in 1860 and passed into the possession of the Schell family in 1866. It is the second oldest family-owned brewery in America and became the oldest and largest brewery in Minnesota when the company bought the Grain Belt rights in 2002.

data.name: I Dream of AMber
data.description: Divulge your taste buds in a beer that combines malty sweetness with a hint of nutty, biscuit flavors.  A rich, red color will have you dreaming for more.

style.name: American-Style Amber (Low Calorie) Lager
style.description: These beers are pale golden to amber in color, light to medium-light in body, and high in carbonation. Calorie level should not exceed 125 per 12 ounce serving. Corn, rice, or other grain or sugar adjuncts may be used but all malt formulations are also made. Malt and hop flavors are mild yet evident. Hop bitterness is evident and hop aroma may be negligible to evident. Light fruity esters are acceptable. Chill haze and diacetyl should be absent.

breweries.name: LTD Brewing Co.
breweries.description: Using an 8 barrel brewing system makes us one of the smallest production breweries in Minnesota.  We focus on providing constant innovation and imagination to the craft beer enthusiast. Having a small, flexible system allows LTD Brewing to challenge the taste-buds of people who dream for a great beer. We are not bound by a style of beer, ingredients or a predetermined idea of what a beer drinker would expect. We are committed to re-inventing the way beer is brewed and providing an experience, not a drink.

breweries.name: Great American Restaurants
breweries.description:
In 1974, Randy Norton and Jim Farley opened a 16 table pizza place in Fairfax City, VA. Mike Ranney joined them a year later, and with the opening of Fantastic Fritzbe’s Flying Food Factory (now Silverado) in 1976, Great American Restaurants was born. Over the past 36 years, their partnership has thrived as a result of their entrepreneurial spirit, enthusiasm for hospitality, and a ton of hard work by thousands of the best team players in the industry.

“GAR is fun because our people take pride in being part of something special and love what we do. Our restaurants are filled with guests and staff that want to have a good time. GAR helps everyone feel great. GAR cares about our people on a whole different level than anyone else… and is also obsessive about the details. A unique combination.”

data.name: Last Chance Lager
data.description: The only true American-style beer (steam beer originated in the West during the late 1800s), this combines the fruitiness of an ale with the firm, rounded flavor of a lager.

data.name: Limestone
data.description: This Limited Spring Seasonal brew, is our 1st ever lager with a crisp, toasty, slightly hoppy taste that is true to the quarries of Minnesota.

style.name: American-Style Amber (Low Calorie) Lager
style.description: These beers are pale golden to amber in color, light to medium-light in body, and high in carbonation. Calorie level should not exceed 125 per 12 ounce serving. Corn, rice, or other grain or sugar adjuncts may be used but all malt formulations are also made. Malt and hop flavors are mild yet evident. Hop bitterness is evident and hop aroma may be negligible to evident. Light fruity esters are acceptable. Chill haze and diacetyl should be absent.

breweries.name: Kinney Creek Brewery
breweries.description: Kinney Creek Brewery started out as a love for beer, and a lack of quality brewed, right priced beer.  After making home brew for a small test group,  things got bigger and bigger.  Now we are making several varieties of beer to accommodate the need for great Midwest Brewed beer.  We source as many of our ingredients that we can from our local neighbors to bring you the very freshest and eco-friendly beer on the market.,   Currently we are expanding our facility, increasing our advertising, expanding our exposure to local bars & restaurants, and introducing our product to new customers.  So please watch for us in your neighborhood.

style.name: American-Style Amber (Low Calorie) Lager
style.description: These beers are pale golden to amber in color, light to medium-light in body, and high in carbonation. Calorie level should not exceed 125 per 12 ounce serving. Corn, rice, or other grain or sugar adjuncts may be used but all malt formulations are also made. Malt and hop flavors are mild yet evident. Hop bitterness is evident and hop aroma may be negligible to evident. Light fruity esters are acceptable. Chill haze and diacetyl should be absent.

breweries.name: Manitou Brewing Company
breweries.description: MBC offers a wide variety of beer styles brewed on location and also craft beer from our favorite breweries around the world. While we offer a few flagship brews year round, our tap selection generally varies from week to week, and of course season to season. If you don’t see your favorite style, stop by and let us know what YOU would like to see us brew…If you ask for it, we will brew it!

data.name: März Attacks
data.description: Our März Attacks is a rich amber lager with a clean, toasty, and bready malt flavor and a subdued hop presence.

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

style.name: American-Style Amber (Low Calorie) Lager
style.description: These beers are pale golden to amber in color, light to medium-light in body, and high in carbonation. Calorie level should not exceed 125 per 12 ounce serving. Corn, rice, or other grain or sugar adjuncts may be used but all malt formulations are also made. Malt and hop flavors are mild yet evident. Hop bitterness is evident and hop aroma may be negligible to evident. Light fruity esters are acceptable. Chill haze and diacetyl should be absent.

breweries.name: Belly Love Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Why Belly Love?

Well... it's hard to put into words the thoughts that led to the name, because so much of it is simply the feeling you have when you consume a carefully, dare I say lovingly, crafted beer. Complex and simple at the same time. Satiating but refreshing. Nourishment for your senses. Quite plainly; beer is liquid soul food.

We feel that beer makes bellies happy and shows them love. So... raise a glass, love your belly; Belly Love!

data.name: Moksha
data.description: Traditional Indian light lagers left a lot to be desired. We wanted to offer a craft beer with a balanced taste which pairs well with the flavors of South Asian cuisine. We searched far and wide for a taste that brings something else to the palate...something unique...something sophisticated...something indulgent...Moksha Craft Amber Lager was born.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: American-Style Amber (Low Calorie) Lager
style.description: These beers are pale golden to amber in color, light to medium-light in body, and high in carbonation. Calorie level should not exceed 125 per 12 ounce serving. Corn, rice, or other grain or sugar adjuncts may be used but all malt formulations are also made. Malt and hop flavors are mild yet evident. Hop bitterness is evident and hop aroma may be negligible to evident. Light fruity esters are acceptable. Chill haze and diacetyl should be absent.

breweries.name: Golden Mongoose
breweries.description: Golden Mongoose offers unique high quality beer and alcoholic beverages. We strive to give our customers upscale products featuring a distinct and flavorful taste.

style.name: American-Style Amber (Low Calorie) Lager
style.description: These beers are pale golden to amber in color, light to medium-light in body, and high in carbonation. Calorie level should not exceed 125 per 12 ounce serving. Corn, rice, or other grain or sugar adjuncts may be used but all malt formulations are also made. Malt and hop flavors are mild yet evident. Hop bitterness is evident and hop aroma may be negligible to evident. Light fruity esters are acceptable. Chill haze and diacetyl should be absent.

breweries.name: Great American Restaurants
breweries.description:
In 1974, Randy Norton and Jim Farley opened a 16 table pizza place in Fairfax City, VA. Mike Ranney joined them a year later, and with the opening of Fantastic Fritzbe’s Flying Food Factory (now Silverado) in 1976, Great American Restaurants was born. Over the past 36 years, their partnership has thrived as a result of their entrepreneurial spirit, enthusiasm for hospitality, and a ton of hard work by thousands of the best team players in the industry.

“GAR is fun because our people take pride in being part of something special and love what we do. Our restaurants are filled with guests and staff that want to have a good time. GAR helps everyone feel great. GAR cares about our people on a whole different level than anyone else… and is also obsessive about the details. A unique combination.”

style.name: American-Style Amber (Low Calorie) Lager
style.description: These beers are pale golden to amber in color, light to medium-light in body, and high in carbonation. Calorie level should not exceed 125 per 12 ounce serving. Corn, rice, or other grain or sugar adjuncts may be used but all malt formulations are also made. Malt and hop flavors are mild yet evident. Hop bitterness is evident and hop aroma may be negligible to evident. Light fruity esters are acceptable. Chill haze and diacetyl should be absent.

breweries.name: Shipyard Brewing
breweries.description: Since 1994, Shipyard Brewing Company has been brewing fine quality products with a wide range of style profiles. We use only top quality ingredients and pride ourselves on the consistency and freshness of our products. All our beer is hand crafted from recipes developed by master brewer Alan Pugsley, one of the most influential people in the craft brewing movement in North America.  Shipyard is available in 35+ states around the country and markets for our freshly brewed, hand-crafted beers continue to expand.
